The University has a long history of supporting community-based organizations and over the years a close working relationship has evolved with a number of the local child care programs.     Below is a small sampling of center-based early childhood programs on or in close proximity to the Washington Square campus. Some provide priority spaces to NYU faculty and staff. For additional resources, contact Carebridge Life Resources .     On Campus     University Plaza Nursery School   Silver Towers - 110 Bleecker Street  For more information, call 212-677-3916   www.universityplazanursery.org   "A parent cooperative providing a creative nurturing and enriching program."     Serving children 2-4 years   Monday through Friday: 9-2   Extended day (2 to 4.30pm) option available   School year program from mid-September to mid-June   Summer program available   Priority given to NYU faculty and staff     Creative Steps Early Care and Education Center   a program of University Settlement   4 Washington Square Village   For more information, call 212-982-2273   www.wsvcreativesteps.com     Serving children 12 months through 4 years   Monday to Friday 9am-3pm, early drop off (8-9)     Extended day option to 6pm   Part-time scheduling available   Summer Program     In Neighborhood     Barrow Street Nursery School   27 Barrow Street  For more information, call 212-633-1203   www.barrowstreetnurseryschool.com   "Child-centered [program] to bring out each child's special interests and abilities."     Serving children 2 through 5 years   Part day and school day programs   Enrichment classes offered midday   Summer day camp     Manhattan Kids Club   350 Avenue of the Americas   For more information, call 212-677-0608     Enrolls children 3 months through 4 years   Monday to Friday: 7:30 a.m. - 6:00 p.m.   Full day, part-week option available   Year 'round program     Sara Curry Preschool at Little Missionary Day Nursery   93 St. Mark's Place  For more information, call 212-633-1203   www.lmdn.org   "Provides a supportive environment where children can express their feelings freely and learn to express the feelings of others."     Serving children 2 through 4 years   Part day and school day programs   Extended day available 3-6 pm   Summer day camp                            NYU/University Settlement Family Child Care Program     Families Caring for Children in the Neighborhood   In 2007, New York University and University Settlement joined efforts to expand child care options in the area by developing high quaility family child care programs with you, your child and your family in mind.     Special program characteristics include:     Priority placement for children of NYU faculty, staff, and students   Nurturing environments tailored for small groups of children, 6 weeks through 4 years of age   Professional child care providers licensed by the NYC Department of Health   Bi-weekly individualized coaching and support from an early childhood education specialist   Bi-monthly workshops focus on curriculum implementation, child development, creative problem-solving, and more   On-going evaluation of the providers' care and educational practice, the child care environment, and children's developmental progress   Rates for full-time care (9:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m.) range from $300 to $450 per week.     For more information contact, kcarpenter@universitysettlement.org                Identify Additional Programs   Carebridge Life Resources    Read more about Carebridge Life Resources full range of services available to NYU faculty, administrators, and staff, 24-hours a day, 7 days a week on-line (User Id: FTN59) and by phone, 800-437-0911.     Talk with a child care specialist to discuss the different child care options available near your home and workplace   Learn how to choose and evaluate child care, early education and school-age programs for quality   Identify your preferences and ask questions about fees and scholarship.   Receive a researched and specially prepared, individualized list of referrals with vacancies. Child and Family Policy Center - NYU Steinhardt                                                                     Skip to content              NYU Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development                                                 Child and Family Policy Center           Department of Applied Psychology                 About      What's Happening at the Center          Overview    Applied Research   Intervention Research   Professional Development   Forum Events              People    Career & Internship Opportunities    Contact                About The Center                        The Child and Family Policy Center at NYU Steinhardt works to bring state-of-the field knowledge about how to promote children's healthy development and school success to the forefront of policymaking, program design, and practice. Faculty and researchers affiliated with the Center conduct research, technical assistance, and research dissemination activities.    This work is supported by the School's multidisciplinary faculty, which includes scholars in child development, health, and education. The Center's primary focus is the well-being and healthy development of young children, age 0 to 8, in school, home, and community setttings.                            Child and Family Therapy                                                                                     Program Overview                                                                                                   This certificate provides a comprehensive spectrum of courses for clinicians interested in expanding and deepening their understanding of work with children ages pre-school through latency. In addition to play therapy, the curriculum includes courses in child development, attachment, parenting, diagnosis of disorders of childhood, and child-focused family interventions. This course utilizes a focus on practice with children and families in a range of settings, including treatment strategies for children who have been traumatized, as well as those seen in schools and family service agencies.                                                                                                                                                                              From the Director: Interview with Judith Siegel, PhD, LCSW            This content requires the Macromedia Flash Player. Get Flash Player                                                                                             Program Requirements                                                                                                   This certificate requires the completion of two semesters over one year. 27 two-and-one-half (2.5) hour sessions will be held over the course of the year. Assignments include weekly readings and a final learning assessment in the form of a project or test.   There are two sections offered. Students must choose one section: Monday evening (6:00 pm to 8:30 pm) or Friday morning (9:15 am to 11:45 am). See the Program Calendar below for details.                                                                                                                                                                                                            Play Therapy Hours                                                                                                   Association of Play Therapy (APT Provider 09-244) approved hours: 36                                                                                                                                                                                                            Program Brochure                                                                                                   Download a program brochure by clicking here .                                                                                                                                                                                                            Program Highlights                                                                                                     Focus on child development from infancy to age 12   Focus on disorders associated with trauma   Explore influence of family dynamics on child behavior   Assessing parenting skills   Play therapy: pre-school through preadolescent children     Play therapy with traumatized children                                                                                                                                                                                                                Continuing Education Contact Hours                                                                                                     35 NASW-approved CEUs will be awarded for this program for the Fall 2014.   32.5 NYSED-approved Contact Hours will be awarded for this program for the Spring 2015. We will begin accepting new applications for 2015-16 in May 2015. The University has a long history of supporting community-based organizations and over the years a close working relationship has evolved with a number of the local child care programs.     Below is a small sampling of center-based early childhood programs on or in close proximity to the Washington Square campus. Some provide priority spaces to NYU faculty and staff. For additional resources, contact Carebridge Life Resources .     On Campus     University Plaza Nursery School   Silver Towers - 110 Bleecker Street  For more information, call 212-677-3916   www.universityplazanursery.org   "A parent cooperative providing a creative nurturing and enriching program." Special program characteristics include:     Priority placement for children of NYU faculty, staff, and students   Nurturing environments tailored for small groups of children, 6 weeks through 4 years of age   Professional child care providers licensed by the NYC Department of Health   Bi-weekly individualized coaching and support from an early childhood education specialist   Bi-monthly workshops focus on curriculum implementation, child development, creative problem-solving, and more   On-going evaluation of the providers' care and educational practice, the child care environment, and children's developmental progress   Rates for full-time care (9:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m.) range from $300 to $450 per week.                            Child and Family Therapy                                                                                     Program Overview                                                                                                   This certificate provides a comprehensive spectrum of courses for clinicians interested in expanding and deepening their understanding of work with children ages pre-school through latency. In addition to play therapy, the curriculum includes courses in child development, attachment, parenting, diagnosis of disorders of childhood, and child-focused family interventions. This course utilizes a focus on practice with children and families in a range of settings, including treatment strategies for children who have been traumatized, as well as those seen in schools and family service agencies.                                                                                                                                                                              From the Director: Interview with Judith Siegel, PhD, LCSW            This content requires the Macromedia Flash Player. Get Flash Player                                                                                             Program Requirements                                                                                                   This certificate requires the completion of two semesters over one year. 27 two-and-one-half (2.5) hour sessions will be held over the course of the year. Assignments include weekly readings and a final learning assessment in the form of a project or test.   There are two sections offered. Students must choose one section: Monday evening (6:00 pm to 8:30 pm) or Friday morning (9:15 am to 11:45 am). See the Program Calendar below for details.                                                                                                                                                                                                            Play Therapy Hours                                                                                                   Association of Play Therapy (APT Provider 09-244) approved hours: 36                                                                                                                                                                                                            Program Brochure                                                                                                   Download a program brochure by clicking here .                                                                                                                                                                                                            Program Highlights                                                                                                     Focus on child development from infancy to age 12   Focus on disorders associated with trauma   Explore influence of family dynamics on child behavior   Assessing parenting skills   Play therapy: pre-school through preadolescent children     Play therapy with traumatized children                                                                                                                                                                                                                Continuing Education Contact Hours                                                                                                     35 NASW-approved CEUs will be awarded for this program for the Fall 2014.   32.5 NYSED-approved Contact Hours will be awarded for this program for the Spring 2015.                            Child and Family Therapy                                                                                     Program Overview                                                                                                   This certificate provides a comprehensive spectrum of courses for clinicians interested in expanding and deepening their understanding of work with children ages pre-school through latency. In addition to play therapy, the curriculum includes courses in child development, attachment, parenting, diagnosis of disorders of childhood, and child-focused family interventions. This course utilizes a focus on practice with children and families in a range of settings, including treatment strategies for children who have been traumatized, as well as those seen in schools and family service agencies.                                                                                                                                                                              From the Director: Interview with Judith Siegel, PhD, LCSW            This content requires the Macromedia Flash Player. Get Flash Player                                                                                             Program Requirements                                                                                                   This certificate requires the completion of two semesters over one year. 27 two-and-one-half (2.5) hour sessions will be held over the course of the year. Assignments include weekly readings and a final learning assessment in the form of a project or test.   There are two sections offered. Students must choose one section: Monday evening (6:00 pm to 8:30 pm) or Friday morning (9:15 am to 11:45 am). See the Program Calendar below for details. Child and Family Policy Center - NYU Steinhardt                                                                     Skip to content              NYU Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development                                                 Child and Family Policy Center           Department of Applied Psychology                 About      What's Happening at the Center          Overview    Applied Research   Intervention Research   Professional Development   Forum Events              People    Career & Internship Opportunities    Contact                About The Center                        The Child and Family Policy Center at NYU Steinhardt works to bring state-of-the field knowledge about how to promote children's healthy development and school success to the forefront of policymaking, program design, and practice. Faculty and researchers affiliated with the Center conduct research, technical assistance, and research dissemination activities.    This work is supported by the School's multidisciplinary faculty, which includes scholars in child development, health, and education. The Center's primary focus is the well-being and healthy development of young children, age 0 to 8, in school, home, and community setttings.
